item.title: Animating plots with gganimate and tweenr
item.description: Animation can be added to ggplot() plots using the gganimate package by David Robinson. Using the CSO Statbank API insert link, we can load in a table of population by county in Ireland for each Census since 1841. library(rjstat) library(tidyverse) library(gganimate) library(tweenr) library(scales) census_url <- "http://www.cso.ie/StatbankServices/StatbankServices.svc/jsonservice/responseinstance/EY001" pop_data <- fromJSONstat(census_url) pop_data <- pop_data[[1]] %>% as_data_frame() To look at county populations, filter to both sexes and filter out the total state populations.

item.title: Accessing the CSO Statbank API
item.description: CSO have an API for access to data on demographics and the economy in the Statbank database. The data is made available in JSON-stat format. There is an R package called rjstat , developed by Aaron Schumacher to read and write data in this format. install.packages("rjstat") library(rjstat) library(tidyverse) The website for the API is here. The JSON data is stored in a url comprising a fixed address plus the table code.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Dan Brennan. I am a transport planner with an interest in data analytics and data science. This website is mainly a collection of notes on programming, statistics and data analytics. The site has been built using the R blogdown package.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
